events.originalText: The ringleaders of the Bali Nine were executed in Indonesia for attempting to smuggle 8.3 kg (18 lb) of heroin to Australia in 2005.
events.subtitle: Bali Nine
events.headline: Bali Nine ringleaders executed in Indonesia for heroin smuggling

events.originalText: Watched by a worldwide television audience of tens of millions, Prince William and Catherine Middleton were married at Westminster Abbey in London.
events.subtitle: William, Prince of Wales
events.headline: Prince William and Catherine Middleton married at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Cyclone Mala made landfall near Thandwe, Myanmar, causing 37 deaths.
events.subtitle: Cyclone Mala
events.headline: Cyclone Mala causes 37 deaths in Myanmar

events.originalText: The Chemical Weapons Convention entered into force, outlawing the production, stockpiling and use of chemical weapons in the 87 countries that had ratified the convention.
events.subtitle: Chemical Weapons Convention
events.headline: Chemical Weapons Convention enters into force in 87 countries

events.originalText: The acquittal of policemen who had beaten African-American motorist Rodney King sparked six days of civil unrest in Los Angeles (damage pictured), during which 63 people were killed.
events.subtitle: Rodney King
events.headline: Rodney King acquittal sparks civil unrest in Los Angeles

events.originalText: A powerful tropical cyclone struck Chittagong, Bangladesh, killing at least 138,000 people and leaving up to 10 million homeless across the region.
events.subtitle: 1991 Bangladesh cyclone
events.headline: Tropical cyclone kills 138,000 in Chittagong, Bangladesh

events.originalText: Vietnam War: North Vietnam concluded its East Sea Campaign by capturing all of the Spratly Islands held by South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: North Vietnam captures Spratly Islands from South Vietnam

events.originalText: Vietnam War: South Vietnamese forces began the Cambodian campaign, aiming to attack North Vietnamese jungle bases.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: South Vietnamese forces launch Cambodian campaign in Vietnam War

events.originalText: The controversial Broadway musical Hair, a product of the counterculture of the 1960s, opened, with its songs becoming anthems of the anti-Vietnam War movement.
events.subtitle: Broadway theatre
events.headline: Controversial musical Hair opens on Broadway

events.originalText: World War II: The U.S. Army liberated Dachau, the first Nazi concentration camp, and killed German prisoners of war.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: U.S. Army liberates Dachau concentration camp in World War II

events.originalText: Second World War: British agent Nancy Wake parachuted into Auvergne, France, becoming a liaison between the Special Operations Executive and the local Maquis group.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British agent Nancy Wake parachutes into France during WWII

events.originalText: Parliament passed the People's Budget, the first budget in British history with the express intent of redistributing wealth.
events.subtitle: Parliament of the United Kingdom
events.headline: People's Budget passed in British Parliament for wealth redistribution

events.originalText: A rockslide buried part of the Canadian mining town of Frank under 110 million tonnes of rock, killing around 70 people.
events.subtitle: Frank Slide
events.headline: Rockslide buries part of Canadian mining town, killing around 70

events.originalText: Confederate forts at Grand Gulf survived a bombardment by Union gunboats, preventing Ulysses S. Grant's troops from crossing the Mississippi River at that point.
events.subtitle: Grand Gulf, Mississippi
events.headline: Confederate forts at Grand Gulf withstand Union bombardment

events.originalText: In Parramatta, Australia, Scottish astronomer James Dunlop discovered Centaurus A (pictured), which was later recognised as one of the nearest radio galaxies to Earth.
events.subtitle: Parramatta
events.headline: Scottish astronomer James Dunlop discovers Centaurus A in Australia

events.originalText: On his first voyage, British explorer James Cook and the crew of HMS Endeavour (pictured) landed at Botany Bay, making the first recorded European landfall on the eastern coast of Australia.
events.subtitle: First voyage of James Cook
events.headline: James Cook lands at Botany Bay on first voyage to Australia

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: France began an unsuccessful attempt to retake Quebec City, which had been captured by Britain.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War
events.headline: France attempts to retake Quebec City in Seven Years' War

events.originalText: The Grand Duchy of Lithuania decisively won the Battle of the Vikhra River, forcibly making the Principality of Smolensk a vassal state.
events.subtitle: Grand Duchy of Lithuania
events.headline: Grand Duchy of Lithuania wins Battle of the Vikhra River
